About me

      Adam Tonsberg

      Experience

      Software Developer – Diyar United Company

      Digital Identity Department | 2024–Present

      Teaching Assistant – Univerity of twente

      2023

      Current projects

      EGate – Biometric Device & Hardware Integration

      • Support field deployments at airports, lead vendor debugging sessions, and represent the team in technical integrations.
      • Develop WPF applications (MVVM) for integrating biometric sensors, gates, cameras, and custom controller hardware.
      • Build .NET modules that interface with native SDKs using P/Invoke, implementing event driven, state machines.
      • Design plugin mechanisms for loading device capabilities and configurations cleanly.
      • Implement interprocess communication using Named Pipes and structured messaging for coordination between services.
      • Improved an internal data streaming pipeline for biometric modules, resulting in speedup for image data transfer.
      • Added an IPC oriented variant and packaged it as an internal NuGet library with message framing and streaming (async) support.

      Prior Projects

      Embedded & EE Projects

      • Firmware development for biomedical sensing on Atmega162 (temporal precision, PDM sequencing, BLE, protocol design).
      • Wireless knee health sensing system prototype using STM32.
      • Class D amplifier - FPGA modules implementing communication interfaces (I2S, I2C, SPI), filtering, and digital PWM.
      • Hardware accelerated DSP operations using C++ with AVX2 intrinsics.
      • Customized NIOS II soft processor for optimized filtering tasks.

      Personal Projects

      • Custom packet protocols and networking algorithms (sliding window, routing, TCP and UDP transport).
      • Simulation work in Python: RNG analysis, numerical methods, molecular dynamics, and complexity analysis.
      • Raspberry Pi NAS configured headlessly via OpenMediaVault.
      • Small games (Pacman, UNO server-client) demonstrating MVC, networking, and clean architecture.

      Education

      BSc Electrical Engineering — University of Twente (2023)
